title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 45-1.1 - Purpose and intent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 45-1.1 - Purpose and intent

State Regulations
(a) The purpose of this Part (rule) is to guard against personal injuries in the
assembly, disassembly and use of amusement devices, temporary structures, viewing stands and tents at carnivals, fairs and amusement parks. (b) It is the intent of this Part (rule) that
such devices, structures, viewing stands and tents shall be so designed, constructed, assembled or disassembled, maintained and operated as to prevent
such injuries. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
45-1.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
